Purchase options and add-ons

About this item

  • Mini Classic Edition: The NES Classic Edition is portable, easy to use, and ideal for travel, with different display modes to choose from.
  • Includes: The original look and feel of the Nintendo Classic Edition, redesigned miniature version, smaller, sleeker, and preloaded with 30 innovative games, HDMI cable, AC adapter, and the NES Classic Mini Controller.
  • 30 Preloaded Games – Some of their action games include Super Mario Bros., Donkey Kong, The Legend of Zelda, PAC-Man, Dr. Mario, Mega Man, Final Fantasy and much more.
  • Compatibility: Compatible with Classic Controller and Classic Controller Pro. The video game controller can also be used in NES Virtual Console games on Wii or Wii U console by connecting it with a Wii remote controller.
  • Four Suspend Slots Per Game: No more worries about unfinished games, with the Nintendo NES save your game with Suspend Points and pick up right where you left off. Simply press the reset button while playing to return to the Home menu and save your progress to a slot.

How customer reviews and ratings work

Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

Learn more how customers reviews work on Amazon

5 Stars
LOVE IT! But, regarding cords, and SIZE....
We wanted to play the old games. WE"RE OLD, o.k.?? But I read the reviews, and "a lot" of people were all, "Waaa, there's no power cord!". Well, since we wanted a second controller anyway, I found a bundle, controller and a power-cord. Funny, that got here 1st, ha-ha! But when I un-box the gaming unit, I pull stuff out, get it up & running, go to toss the box. It rattles. In a "sub-basement" of the packaging, is the deal you see on the left. Granted, I'm not an electrician, but it would/does connect to the widget from my phone charger, shown on the right. Maybe it wouldn't work, again, not an electrician, but there IS a cord that comes with it, that plugs into the power portal. I also keep getting questions about 'will the old cartridges fit?'. NO. Here is the new one, atop the old one (because we like TETRIS and a couple others) The tuna should help you see the size difference

ShopSmarter
5.0 out of 5 stars Original NES Classic Mini European edition
Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Verified Purchase
Upon inspection, this looks to be the real deal. There are lots of fakes out there, but not in my opinion is that the case here, the unit checks out. Packaging matches the listing, but it might look different to some because it is the European model. The differences between North American and European NES are minor: no color poster included and no power adapter included, which makes sense because North American power adapters are very different from those in Europe. Other than that, it's identical and includes the same 30 games. As most know, the NES classic mini have been extremely difficult to find since the announcement. Very pleased to have one.

Robert Robinson
5.0 out of 5 stars Nostalgia!
Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
Verified Purchase
Functionally speaking, mine has worked perfectly. No issues. As others in the reviews have said, you need a 5v 1amp adapter to plug into the wall if you don't want to plug into the TV to power it. I tried a 2amp adapter and the system would not turn on. So, it definitely must be a 1amp. The controller cord is incredibly short. I recommend getting a set of longer ones. I wanted a second controller anyhow so that didn't matter to me. I got a set of 10ft controllers and have been fine. I like that I can save my spots for every game in the system. You can find the whole listing on NES' website. This thing is so tiny! Shows how far tech has come. All those games on this lil thing. The only downside, which isn't a downside because I thought about it before getting and made the choice is that the games on this system are built in. There are no cartridges. That means if I want more, I cannot have them. If you want games not on the listing, you then you should with a different system than the mini and be able to swap cartridges. If that is not a concern, then you're all set like me!
